Package com.im.njams.sdk.communication.fragments

Class SplitSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.im.njams.sdk.communication.fragments.SplitSupport
  • public class SplitSupport
extends Object
    Splits large messages according to the configuration setting NjamsSettings.PROPERTY_MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE or using a technical size limit caused by the used transport implementation.
    Author:
    cwinkler

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  SplitSupport.Range
      Simple immutable container for two int values defining a from/to range.
      class  SplitSupport.SplitIterator
      Iterator for message chunks having some additional methods for getting size (chunk count) and current index.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int MIN_SIZE_LIMIT
      The minimum value allowed as max message size
      static String TESTING_NO_LIMIT_CHECKS
      For testing only.

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SplitSupport​(Settings settings, int techLimit)
      Constructor that initializes this instance from the given Settings.
      SplitSupport​(Properties properties, int techLimit)
      Constructor that initializes this instance from the given Properties.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addChunkHeaders​(BiConsumer<String,​String> headersUpdater, int currentChunk, int totalChunks, String messageKey)
      Passes chunk-related headers to the given headers updater function if required.
      int getMaxMessageSize()
      The configured (or resolved) max message size in bytes that this instance uses.
      List<SplitSupport.Range> getSplitIndexes​(String data)
      Calculates the indexes in terms of String.substring(int, int) where to split the given data so that each chunk fits into this instance's max-message size.

      Note: Users should prefer using the iterator(String) which correctly evaluates the split indexes.
      boolean isSplitting()
      Returns whether or not a max-message size limit is active that requires splitting larger messages.
      SplitSupport.SplitIterator iterator​(String data)
      Returns a new SplitSupport.SplitIterator for the given data that iterates over the data's chunks according to this instance's max-message size.

    • Field Detail

      • TESTING_NO_LIMIT_CHECKS

        public static final String TESTING_NO_LIMIT_CHECKS
        For testing only. Disables limit checks for NjamsSettings.PROPERTY_MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MIN_SIZE_LIMIT

        public static final int MIN_SIZE_LIMIT
        The minimum value allowed as max message size
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • SplitSupport

        public SplitSupport​(Settings settings,
                    int techLimit)
        Constructor that initializes this instance from the given Settings.
        Parameters:
        settings - Settings to be used for initializing this instance.
        techLimit - Technical limitation of the maximum message size enforced by the transport implementation, if any. This works as an upper limit. Set to 0 or less if there is no such limit.

      • SplitSupport

        public SplitSupport​(Properties properties,
                    int techLimit)
        Constructor that initializes this instance from the given Properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - Properties to be used for initializing this instance.
        techLimit - Technical limitation of the maximum message size enforced by the transport implementation, if any. This works as an upper limit. Set to 0 or less if there is no such limit.

    • Method Detail

      • isSplitting

        public boolean isSplitting()
        Returns whether or not a max-message size limit is active that requires splitting larger messages. If false using this instance can be avoided for better performance.
        Returns:
        Whether splitting is active.

      • getSplitIndexes

        public List<SplitSupport.Range> getSplitIndexes​(String data)
        Calculates the indexes in terms of String.substring(int, int) where to split the given data so that each chunk fits into this instance's max-message size.

        Note: Users should prefer using the iterator(String) which correctly evaluates the split indexes.
        Parameters:
        data - The data for which split indexes are calculated.
        Returns:
        List of indexes for splitting the given input data.
        See Also:
        iterator(String)

      • iterator

        public SplitSupport.SplitIterator iterator​(String data)
        Returns a new SplitSupport.SplitIterator for the given data that iterates over the data's chunks according to this instance's max-message size.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to iterate as chunks
        Returns:
        An iterator for given data's chunks.

      • getMaxMessageSize

        public int getMaxMessageSize()
        The configured (or resolved) max message size in bytes that this instance uses.
        Returns:
        The configured (or resolved) max message size in bytes. Always ≥0.

      • addChunkHeaders

        public void addChunkHeaders​(BiConsumer<String,​String> headersUpdater,
                            int currentChunk,
                            int totalChunks,
                            String messageKey)
        Passes chunk-related headers to the given headers updater function if required.
        Parameters:
        headersUpdater - Function that accepts key/value strings and is backed on a message's headers/properties.
        currentChunk - The index (based on 0) of the current chunk. I.e., the current iteration index when processing the chunks.
        totalChunks - The total number of chunks to be sent for the current message. If < 2, this method will do nothing.
        messageKey - The unique message key that identifies the chunks that belong to a single message.
